metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7795 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The manager_invoke_notify_message function in systemd 231 and earlierallows local users to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and PID1 hang) via a zero-length message received over a notify socket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu10
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu10
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu10
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu10
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu10
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu10
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu10
udev - 229-4ubuntu10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu10').
